description: To carry out tree surgery, including a crown reduction to one Oak, within Area 1 on TPO 394.
decision_conditions: The Oak tree is situated within the rear garden of 10 The Broadwalk and can be seen from Lowswood Close. The Oak has a high amenity value and significantly contribute to local biodiversity and Area of Special Local Character (Copsewood Estate). It contributes to a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the copse wood estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the tree is both present and future because it has the potential for long life expectancy.

The Oak has an attractive crown typical of this species. It does currently have a few branches growing close to the roof of 1 Lowswood Close, the pruning of these to create a 1m clearance are exempt from the application process and can be pruned to abate a nuisance. One of the reasons for the work is that they can not use half their driveway due to it being dangerous however they have ticked "no" to point 6.1 condition of the tree and they h
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Clearance of roof: Work to create a clearance of 1m between the roof and tree branches, by cutting back secondary and tertiary branches (thereby abating the nuisance) does not require the formal consent of the Council.
